intro: Euphrasia fennica, commonly known as the Finnish eyebright, is a small perennial herb native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and heathlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals and a distinctive, spurred lower petal. Euphrasia fennica is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and healing properties.
